workflow.name: Securely call Google Cloud Run APIs with service account auth (main-workflow)
workflow.description:
## Who it‚Äôs for? 
Anyone who wants a simple, secure way to call a **Google Cloud Run** endpoint from n8n‚Äîwithout exposing it publicly. 

People who want a cheap/free-tier way to run custom API logic without hosting n8n or spinning up servers. Example: you‚Äôve got scraping code that needs specific system/python libs‚Äîbuild it into a Dockerfile on Cloud Run, then call it as a secure endpoint from n8n.


## How it works
This is a **conjunctive workflow**: the main workflow calls **Service Auth (sub-workflow)** to get a Google **ID token**, merges that auth with your context, then calls your Cloud Run URL with `Authorization: Bearer <id_token>`. Works great for single calls or looping over items.

## How to set up

General instructions below‚Äîsee my detailed guide for more info: 

**[Build a Secure Google Cloud Run API, Then Call It from n8n (Free Tier)](https://medium.com/@marcocodes/build-a-secure-google-cloud-run-api-then-call-it-from-n8n-88c03291a95f)**

Setup:
1. Create a Cloud Run service and enable **Require authentication (Cloud IAM)**.
2. Create a Google **Service Account** and grant **Cloud Run Invoker** on that service.
3. In n8n, import the workflows and update the **Vars** node (`service_url`, optional `service_path`).
4. Create a **JWT (PEM)** credential from your service account key, then run.
5. Make sure to read the **sticky notes** in the workflows‚Äîthey contain helpful pointers and optional configurations.

## Requirements
- Cloud Run service URL (auth required)  
- Google Service Account with **Cloud Run Invoker**  
- Private key JSON fields downloaded from Service Account | needed to generate JWT credentials

## How to customize
Change the HTTP method/path/body in **Cloud Run Request**, or drop the **Service Auth (sub-workflow)** into other workflows to reuse the same auth pattern.

## More details
Full write-up (minimal + modular flows), screenshots, and more:  

**[Build a Secure Google Cloud Run API, Then Call It from n8n (Free Tier)](https://medium.com/@marcocodes/build-a-secure-google-cloud-run-api-then-call-it-from-n8n-88c03291a95f)** 
‚Äî by Marco Cassar

parameters.content:
# Running the Workflow

## Run it
- Click **Execute** (or **Execute workflow**).
- Make sure `service_url` and option `service_path` is set.

## What happens
- Calls the **Service Auth (sub-workflow)** to validate or create a Google **ID token**.
- Calls your **Google Cloud Run** service with `Authorization: Bearer <id_token>` and returns the endpoint‚Äôs response.

## Check results
- Open the **Cloud Run Request** node to see the status and response body.
- If it fails, inspect the **Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE Request** output and Cloud Run logs.

## Extra Configurations for Workflow
### Google Credentials (Service Account)
- Open a **Google** node ‚Üí **Create New Credential**
- **Authentication:** Service Account
- **Service account email:** `client_email` from your `.json private key`
- **Private key:** `private_key` from your `.json private key` (entire block, incl. BEGIN/END)
- **Save** the credential  
- **Enable the relevant Google API** in Cloud Console (e.g., Sheets API, Drive API), and **share the target resource** with the service account‚Äôs `client_email` (e.g., share the Sheet/Folder so it has access).
* Save Credential

### Merge node ‚Äî gathers all context.

Use a **Merge** node to add the auth context (`id_token`) to items.

- **Mode:** `Combine`
- **Combine By:** `All Possible Combinations`

### Split Out node ‚Äî iterate array, keep context
- **Operation:** Split Out Items
- **Field to split:** `<your_array_field>`
- **Include:** **All other fields** (keeps `id_token`, `service_url`, etc.)
- **Result:** one item per array element

#### Point to Service Auth
#### (sub-workflow)

###### If you are lost
###### read my Medium article
###### linked in the main sticky note

## Required Setup ‚Äî Google Cloud Run & Service Account
### You‚Äôll need to:
- **Configure a Google Cloud Run service** (set **Require authentication**).
- **Create a Google Service Account** and grant it **Cloud Run Invoker** permission on that service.

For a detailed, step-by-step breakdown, see my Medium article:

**[Build a Secure Google Cloud Run API, Then Call It from n8n (Free Tier)](https://medium.com/@marcocodes/build-a-secure-google-cloud-run-api-then-call-it-from-n8n-88c03291a95f)**

#### Var Config
- **service_url** - base url to cloud run service
- **service_path** - (optional) page path

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
